author: Special Correspondent
text:
Newly constructed Slum Clearance Board tenements at Suriyampalayam in Erode which was inaugurated by Chief Minister Jayalalithaa through video-conferencing on Tuesday. —PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

As many as 204 tenements constructed by the Slum Clearance Board at Suriyampalayam in the city were formally inaugurated by Chief Minister Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Tuesday through video-conferencing.

The Board had spent Rs. 8.71 lakh to construct each house on a 396 sq. ft. area consisting of a drawing room, a bedroom, kitchen and a toilet. The tenements have been provided with power connection, black-topped roads, concrete pavements, storm water drainages, street lights, and provision for rain water harvesting. Deputy Mayor K.C. Palanichamy took part in a function at Suriyampalayam.
title: 204 Slum Clearance Board tenements inaugurated
